statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem}\\ \text{graphically. Minimise and maximise }\\ Z=x+2y \text{ subject to the constraints}\\ x+2y \ge 100, 2x-y \le 0,\, 2x+y\le 200\\ \text{and } (x , y) \ge 0

step.context: \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?}
\text{What is the value of the Minimum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?}
step.tex: \begin{align} \text{Corner Points}\qquad &Z=x+2y \\ (0, 200) \qquad &400 \rightarrow\text{Maximum} \\ (0, 50) \qquad &100 \\ (20, 40) \qquad &100 \\ (50, 100) \qquad &250 \end{align} \\ \text{Minimum 100 at all points joining}\\ (0, 50) \text{ and } (20, 40)
step.reason: \text{Objective function }x+2y=100 \text{ and}\\ \text{constraint }x+2y \ge 100 \text{ are colinear and}\\ \text{through the point of Minimum }(0, 50)
